poem:
"Immutable Borders in Vulnerable Times"

Two leaders rise, in a dawn's sober hues,
A line in sand, a ragged divide brooding.
One in Brownsville, one in Eagle Pass,
A tale of two cities, in gentle justice eluding.
Whispers of migration's lament weave their trail,
Each step weighed on the scale of election's wailing.
Beneath the same azure sky's vast mockery,
Two hearts throb to the beat of a nation's ailing.
